title: Add 'Manage GCP VM Instance' Interactive Flow
summary: Add a CLI command that lets a user pick a VM instance from an interactive list and then start or terminate (stop) it. Defaults to interactive mode; also supports a non-interactive mode for CI/scripts. Note: In Google Compute Engine, "terminate" is commonly used to mean stop (power off) without deleting the instance. This task does not delete instances.

success_criteria.text: gcp vm manage works interactively: select instance → choose action → confirm → success message shows final state.
Non-interactive runs with --instance, --action, --yes succeed without prompts.
--wait returns only after operation completes; prints accurate final state.
Clear error messages for missing auth, missing permissions, and not-found resources.
JSON output is valid and includes final_status.
Docs added to README (with examples above).

acceptance_checks.text: User can start a new instance.
User can stop an existing instance.
Interactive flow allows selection of instance and action.
Safety confirmation is prompted for 'stop' action in interactive mode.
Non-interactive mode works with all required flags.
--dry-run flag shows planned action without execution.
--wait flag correctly polls for operation completion.

prompts: Start a new task for a instance manager feature similar to this:

Here’s a crisp, Cursor-ready task description you can drop into your repo. It’s scoped to add an interactive "manage instance" flow to your existing GCP VM CLI (you already have "list"). I’ve kept it sceptical about edge-cases and destructive actions, and forward-looking so you can extend it later.

non_goals: Changing machine type, disk, network, or metadata.

cli_ux.interactive_example:
$ mycli gcp vm manage
Select an instance:
  1) web-01 (RUNNING)  europe-west1-b
  2) batch-02 (TERMINATED)  europe-west1-b
> 1

Action for "web-01":
  1) Start
  2) Terminate (Stop)
> 2

You are about to STOP instance "web-01" in europe-west1-b (project my-proj).
Type the instance name to confirm: web-01
Stopping... ✓   Current status: TERMINATED
non_interactive_examples:
$ mycli gcp vm manage --instance web-01 --zone europe-west1-b --project my-proj --action stop --yes
Stopping... ✓   Current status: TERMINATED

$ mycli gcp vm manage --instance web-01 --zone europe-west1-b --project my-proj --action start --wait
Starting... ✓   Current status: RUNNING

flags: --zone <name> (optional; falls back to env/config or instance default if unique)
--dry-run (show what would happen; no API calls)
--quiet (suppress prompts; implies non-interactive + requires all flags)
